> [ssdifnskdjfnsdjk](#comment_1_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnXadUtS): I would not say interpol is conrolled, but rather it "may be influenced". World is not (and it will not be if it continue this way) a perfect place. Interesting document, thank you for sharing it and this blog post.

Yes, offering a service for a financial fee might very well be the future of law enforcement this century, certainly in 'The West' at least. I've made some cursory research these past 10 years & it would seem a number of European countries are very keen to introduce so-called 'Super Max' prisons but they're hindered by European human rights law, how frustrating for them :( 

Of course we know GCHQ provides a contract to the NSA & also funding for police forces in a number of European countries is being scaled-back creating instability due to increased crime levels (UK, France, Belgium, Germany, Sweden, Denmark, Norway, Spain to name a few). 

Another prominent case is the UK, where lethal knife crime & flagrant acid attacks in London have sky-rocketed in 2018. 

It will be interesting to follow what happens next. Will the formula of problem-reaction-solution be applied to solve the issue of record-breaking violent crime across Europe?

Perhaps this might lead to the European human rights law being amended, to pave the way for the introduction of privatized 'Super Max' prisons, a la the USA? 

Time will tell !
